item.title: Report E-2024040609
item.description:
Report E-2024040609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 16, 2024, two (2) 3-gallon pails of UN1760 were crushed and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pails were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers were placed into one (1) 5-gallon bucket. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024041134
item.description:
Report X-2024041134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY A LOADER ON THE PD 11. THE LOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE AND USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON TWO OF THE INNER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND TWO OUNCES OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALLED FIBERBOARD BOX

item.title: Report X-2024041065
item.description:
Report X-2024041065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE SD1 FOR A LEAKING FLMAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND SPILL CART. UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. LEAKING PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WERE PLACED INTO A SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
